Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. Without written report.

Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Introduced in Senate

summary.text:
Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse Conveyance Act - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to convey to Teton County, Wyoming, the building and site located at 145 East Simpson Street, Jackson, Wyoming, known as the Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse.

Exempts such conveyance from the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act.

Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse Conveyance Act - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to offer to convey to Teton County, Wyoming, the parcel of land located at 145 East Simpson Street, Jackson, Wyoming, and the building on such land known as the Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse.

Directs the Administrator to require the County to pay: (1) nominal consideration for the parcel, and (2) fair market value for the building.

Allows the Administrator, in lieu of the County's payment for the building, to accept any credits or waivers against lease payments, amounts expended by the County under facility maintenance agreements, or other charges for the continued occupancy or use by the federal government.

Requires the deed for conveyance to include a covenant providing that the parcel and building will be for public use.

Requires proceeds from the conveyance to be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund.

Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse Conveyance Act - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to offer to convey to Teton County, Wyoming, the parcel of land located at 145 East Simpson Street, Jackson, Wyoming, and the building on such land known as the Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse.

Directs the Administrator to require the County to pay: (1) nominal consideration for the parcel, and (2) fair market value for the building.

Allows the Administrator, in lieu of the County's payment for the building, to accept any credits or waivers against lease payments, amounts expended by the County under facility maintenance agreements, or other charges for the continued occupancy or use by the federal government.

Requires the deed for conveyance to include a covenant providing that the parcel and building will be for public use.

Requires proceeds from the conveyance to be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the Senate on September 9, 2014. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse Conveyance Act - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to offer to convey to Teton County, Wyoming, the parcel of land located at 145 East Simpson Street, Jackson, Wyoming, and the building on such land known as the Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse.

Directs the Administrator to require the County to pay: (1) nominal consideration for the parcel, and (2) fair market value for the building.

Allows the Administrator, in lieu of the County's payment for the building, to accept any credits or waivers against lease payments, amounts expended by the County under facility maintenance agreements, or other charges for the continued occupancy or use by the federal government.

Requires the deed for conveyance to include a covenant providing that the parcel and building will be for public use.

Requires proceeds from the conveyance to be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund.

(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the Senate on September 9, 2014. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse Conveyance Act - Directs the Administrator of General Services (GSA) to offer to convey to Teton County, Wyoming, the parcel of land located at 145 East Simpson Street, Jackson, Wyoming, and the building on such land known as the Clifford P. Hansen Federal Courthouse.

Directs the Administrator to require the County to pay: (1) nominal consideration for the parcel, and (2) fair market value for the building.

Allows the Administrator, in lieu of the County's payment for the building, to accept any credits or waivers against lease payments, amounts expended by the County under facility maintenance agreements, or other charges for the continued occupancy or use by the federal government.

Requires the deed for conveyance to include a covenant providing that the parcel and building will be for public use.

Requires proceeds from the conveyance to be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
